landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges Plaintiff is a tenant at 45 Green Street, Defendant is owner/landlord, and that Plaintiff entered a tenancy/lease on Feb. 1, 2022 with rent paid to Defendant (¶¶1–3).

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant represented the leak was "totally fixed," then repeatedly declined to make prompt or adequate repairs, called the problem "cosmetic," and failed to remediate after notice (¶¶5–8, 12, 16).

substantial_interference.reasoning: Complaint alleges ongoing, worsening water intrusion that ruined a laptop, created persistent musty odor and alleged mold-related headaches, and forced Plaintiff to avoid/use only roughly half the unit—facts plausibly showing substantial interference with use and enjoyment (¶¶9–11, 16–17).

causation.reasoning: Complaint alleges the leak recurred at the same location after the tenant moved in, Plaintiff notified Defendant, and Defendant failed to timely/adequately repair or remediate, linking the landlord's representations and omissions to the continuing water intrusion and its harms (¶¶5–9, 12, 16–18).

damages.reasoning: Complaint alleges actual monetary loss (ruined laptop ~ $900), loss of use of a significant portion of the premises, diminished rental value, inconvenience, emotional distress, and requests compensatory and equitable relief (¶¶9, 11, 13, 19; Prayer A–B).
